summary: The Human-Animal Chimera Prohibition Act of 2025 aims to prohibit the creation, transfer, transport, or receipt of certain human-animal chimeras. It defines a "prohibited human-animal chimera" broadly, encompassing embryos with mixed human and nonhuman genetic material or characteristics. Violators face fines and imprisonment. The bill also includes a technical amendment to update the table of chapters in Title 18 of the United States Code.
